steps.title: Cut the meat into � inch strips.
steps.content: Cut the meat into � inch strips. Trim away all visible fat. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Combine the meat with the soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper and garlic in a large bowl.
steps.content: Combine the meat with the soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper and garlic in a large bowl.

steps.title: Cover with plastic wrap if the bowl does not come with a cover and marinate the meat in the refrigerator for 1 to 2 hours to allow the flavors to penetrate the meat.
steps.content: Cover with plastic wrap if the bowl does not come with a cover and marinate the meat in the refrigerator for 1 to 2 hours to allow the flavors to penetrate the meat.

steps.title: Place the meat and marinade into a saucepan, turn the stove burner on high and bring to a boil.
steps.content: Place the meat and marinade into a saucepan, turn the stove burner on high and bring to a boil.

steps.title: Boil for 3 to 5 minutes to sanitize the meat before dehydrating.
steps.content: Boil for 3 to 5 minutes to sanitize the meat before dehydrating.

steps.title: Remove the strips of meat with a pair of tongs and let them drain on paper towels.
steps.content: Remove the strips of meat with a pair of tongs and let them drain on paper towels.

steps.title: Turn the oven on to the lowest setting.
steps.content: Turn the oven on to the lowest setting.

steps.title: Place the strips of meat directly onto the racks, leaving enough space between the strips for air flow.
steps.content: Place the strips of meat directly onto the racks, leaving enough space between the strips for air flow. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Crack open the oven door 1 to 2 inches (2.5 to 5.1 cm) to further encourage air flow.
steps.content: Crack open the oven door 1 to 2 inches (2.5 to 5.1 cm) to further encourage air flow. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Dry the meat anywhere from 8 to 12 hours.
steps.content: Dry the meat anywhere from 8 to 12 hours. The meat is dehydrated when it cracks but does not snap. There should be no moisture present, as this is where bacteria will grow. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Let the dehydrated meat cool before storing.
steps.content: Let the dehydrated meat cool before storing. Place the strips of meat on cooling racks.

steps.title: Put the meat into airtight containers or zip lock bags.
steps.content: Put the meat into airtight containers or zip lock bags. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Store the dehydrated meat at room temperature for 1 to 2 months or freeze the dehydrated meat for a longer shelf life.
steps.content: Store the dehydrated meat at room temperature for 1 to 2 months or freeze the dehydrated meat for a longer shelf life.
